intro: Babiana nana subsp. maculata, commonly known as the spotted babiana, is a small, flowering plant native to the Western Cape of South Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, colorful flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, often with distinctive markings. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
